---
title: Trump's America vs. Nazi Germany
---

## Trump's America vs. Nazi Germany
![Trump vs. Hitler](https://www.jta.org/wp-content/uploads/2016/03/trump-hitler.jpg)

I know what you're thinking with that provocative title. "Oh boy, another liberal kid crying 'orange man bad'." I'm probably not the first nor the last to write such a thing as this, and you're probably tired of hearing it. But if you would be so kind, please hear me out.

I love history because it helps us understand the mistakes our species has made in the past. It helps us to understand our differences. I think a lot of valuable insight can be found when comparing the past and the present. That is what I hope to accomplish with this post.

(I guess this is what my blog is going to be like.)

### What woke me up
I was just scrolling facebook, looking for memes, when out of the blue [this article](https://www.wbez.org/shows/wbez-news/ohare-standoff-federal-officials-detaining-three-children-of-undocumented-parents/285e32de-2516-4be0419e913) pops up. The gist is that three children who are U.S. citizens were detained at an airport for 12+ hours. There's a lot of miscommunication as to why, but my gut tells me it was either 1) because they were profiled, 2) to catch their immigrant mother, or both. Now, maybe you think, "eh, that isn't that crazy." But this comes after many months of [awful immigrant detentions and family separations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trump_administration_migrant_detentions). I mean, just look at some of the pictures on that page. I can hardly believe it. 

After I read that first article, that's when my conscience went "wait a minute... this isn't normal."

### Hitler's Rise to Power
![Becoming Chancellor](data:image/jpeg;base64,)

I give this background because it's important to remember that Hitler didn't just show up one day and go, "Are you all sick and tired of this? Well, I have a solution. Let's take over the world and exterminate any racial impurities in it!" and everyone was like, "Sweet, sounds like a plan!" It's important to understand what happened that allowed such a person to be put into power.

#### Economic Crisis
![Buying groceries](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/8/89/Bundesarchiv_Bild_183-R1215-506%2C_Berlin%2C_Reichsbank%2C_Geldauflieferungsstelle.jpg)
*Imagine seeing this at Wal-Mart.*

Let's go back to 1920s Germany. The German people are suffering greatly. They've just lost World War I. War reparations and inflation have rendered their currency basically worthless (I've heard stories of people using wheelbarrows to transport marks to the store just to buy some bread). It was a really tough time to be German.

#### Blaming Others
![Blaming Jews](https://motl.org/wp-content/uploads/2018/11/kristallnacht.jpg)

Though it was already commonplace in much of the world up to this point, this is when antisemitism really started taking a hold of popular opinion in Germany. As humans, it's hard to accept that our economic misfortunes are due to our own decisions, technological growing pains, or even just bad luck. No, the age-old favorite explanation is that we're suffering because X group of people or Y person caused it! For Hitler, X = Jews, Communists, Gypsies, people with disabilities, or really anyone that was different either culturally or racially.
